entry.title: Add trigger source parameter to GetReopenPopupArgs() and UpdatePopup().
entry.content:
Recently, Autofill introduced the concept of a

AutofillSuggestionTriggerSource, which describes what mechanism

triggered a suggestion (e.g. clicking into a text field). The trigger

source is only properly used by Autofill. For the password manager, it

is always set to kPasswordManager.



GetReopenPopupArgs() and UpdatePopup() are two functions of

AutofillClient that are used to modify an existing popup. They are

currently only used by the password manager, and thus hardcode a

trigger source of kPasswordManager.

This CL removed this hardcoded constant and makes the trigger source

a parameter of the aforementioned functions. In the password manager

code, where the functions are called, kPasswordManager is passed in

as an argument. This change is purely mechanical.



Bug: 1446318

Change-Id: I35bbcbf45480356d48cf8f44e6198b6cb84242d8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4603848

Commit-Queue: Florian Leimgruber

Reviewed-by: Peter Beverloo

Reviewed-by: Rohit Rao

entry.title: ash: Concludes event metrics in PreDispatchEvent for nested events
entry.content:
Events like mouse dragged could enter a nested move loop. As a result,

the event that triggers the loop could have arbitrarily long latency

because it concludes after the loop exit in PostDispatchEvent.

This CL resolves the issue by concluding the current event metrics

in WindowEventDispatcher::PreDispatchEvent.



As a side effect, UiMetricsRecorderTest.KeyEvent no longer needs

the DisableIME() work around since the IME re-dispatched key event

concludes the outer key event.



Bug: b:287644980, b:258382822

Change-Id: I8d9ae357d4f9d3fc5887fb8964350b0bf5e3217e

entry.title: [Lacros] Use the Prefs service to propagate extension-set proxies
entry.content:
Extension-set proxies are mapped to the proxy_config::prefs::kProxy pref.



Currently extension proxies are intercepted by the

LacrosExtensionProxyTracker which sends the proxy config along with the

extension metadata to Ash using the NetworkSettingsService mojo service.



This CL uses the existing Prefs service to propagate proxy configs set

by extensions in the primary profile to Ash.



Extensions running in secondary profiles can still set the proxy

preference at browser level.



Bug: b/267135604

entry.title: Stop immediately discarding scoped_refptrs from CookieSettingsFactory
entry.content:
Calling `.get()` on the scoped_refptr immediately, without storing it

in a local variable, allows the pointee to potentially be freed by

~scoped_refptr, so there's no guarantee that the pointer isn't dangling

after the full expression containing `.get()` has been evaluated.



The `.get()` call in PrivacySandboxSettingsFactory is especially

dangerous (IIUC), since it discards the first scoped_refptr, then

immediately constructs another scoped_refptr (implicitly). That

pointer is never vended out by PrivacySandboxSettingsImpl, so its

reference count will be 1 until ~PrivacySandboxSettingsImpl runs,

at which point the underlying CookieSettings will be freed (even

if other consumers still hold scoped_refptrs to it!).



Change-Id: I24d1f800ef0f62f921c15e3acbd046b40f1eee3f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4682856

Commit-Queue: Avi Drissman

Auto-Submit: Chris Fredrickson

Reviewed-by: Avi Drissman

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1169914}

entry.title: [task-attribution] Move to an implicit GCed task container model
entry.content:
The current task_container_ is a circular buffer with limited space.

That limits the potential use cases for TaskAttribution, and adds

needless complexity. This CL significantly simplifies that model, by

moving the container to be implicit, and relying on GC to clean up tasks

once they are no longer needed - that is, once all their descendent

tasks were done and evicted.





Change-Id: I5d081a3d4208f3b942b9b7f77b539e56cf787c11

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4614509

entry.title: Add GPU machine time shard max threshold
entry.content:
Adds --shard-max-threshold to the GPU machine times script. When

specified, steps whose max shard time is under the specified number of

seconds will be omitted from the script output. This makes it easy to

find problematic steps when trying to get shard times under some

threshold.

entry.title: Allow WaitUntilConditionOrTimeout() to pump the Chromium message loop
entry.content:
Test-only change. More details in the linked bug.

Before this CL, there was base::test::ios::WaitUntilCondition() with a

run_message_loop parameter. It was marked as deprecated because it

caused tests to fail via DCHECK instead of a more graceful way.

WaitUntilConditionOrTimeout() is the preferred version these days.

It returns a bool saying whether the wait succeeded.



This CL:

- Adds a version of WaitUntilConditionOrTimeout() which takes the

run_message_loop parameter. The implementation is basically the same

as the deprecated function, only the timer is different. I.e. it

doesn't use ElapsedTimer.

- Migrates uses of the deprecated function and deletes it. One of

ASSERT_TRUE(), GREYAssertTrue() or CHECK() is added as appropriate.

- Keeps all existing numerical timeouts, to avoid causing new

test failures.



Bug: 1462320

Change-Id: I3755c6f25a096b3acfc9f720d3b5c7aec3f154e5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4675811

entry.title: Add test cases for and a missing piece of the wireup of the soft nav LCP UKM reporting
entry.content:
This CL adds browser test coverage for soft nav LCP UKM recording.

Each field of LCP details is verified to be reported. This test is a

parameterized test with the SoftNavigationHeuristics flag being the

variable. If the SoftNavigationHeuristics flag is on, the LCP timing

values are also verified against the web exposed value.

The soft nav start time value + soft nav lcp value should be equal to

the exposed soft nav lcp value, as the soft nav lcp is relative to

the soft nav start time.



Also, in previous wiring up for the soft nav lcp discovery time, one

piece was missed out. It is detected by the test and added in

this CL.

entry.title: [iOS] Always tear down the scene when it gets disconnected
entry.content:
Before this CL, it was supposed that if a Scene is not at least at the

normal stage of initialization, a transition to a new activation level

could be ignored.



Actually, there is one case where this was false. If the scene was

disconnected before it reached the "normal" stage, it may still have

some elements to tear down.



This CL split the level `SceneActivationLevelUnattached` in two, adding the level `SceneActivationLevelDisconnected`; ensuring that

the scene controller can distinguish whether the UI is being set-up

or tear-down, and behaving accordingly.



The crash can be reproduce on ipad this way:

* open two window

* put a breakpoint in sceneControllerâs init

* restart chrome.

* wait for second breakpoint to trigger (as it init two scene)

* While on the breakpoint, on the ipad, force to quit the window that is

not yet loaded

* restart the run



It should be possible to also do it without breakpoint by being fast

enough (or simply having a slow ipad)



Fixed: 1462891

Change-Id: Ic115a6e492dd4f0001818dbcf844aa26f4a0d2f9

entry.title: WebRtcAudioSink::Adapter: properly move scoped_refptr for destruction
entry.content:
webrtc::AudioProcessorInterface must be destroyed on the main thread, but currently isn't always.



The audioProcessorInterface is std::move'd into a task intended to destroy it on the main thread, but the code uses a const reference which forces the scoped_refptr to be copied instead of moved. This leaves the scoped_refptr in WebRtcAudioSink::~Adapter alive, and if the main thread task is immediately executed then the Adapter (sometimes destroyed on the signaling thread) may be the last dereferencer of the webrtc::AudioProcessorInterface.



This is a quick bugfix to stop crashes. The underlying problem is arguably the API: AudioProcessorInterface is refcounted but requires destruction on a specific thread. This can probably be avoided by managing resources in AudioProcessorInterface implementations more carefully, I am looking into that.

entry.title: wpt: remove legacy 'perform_actions' directory
entry.content:
The upstream directory is webdriver/tests/classic/perform_actions/.



The current directory (webdriver/tests/perform_actions/) is likely a

leftover that used to exist before all webdriver classic tests were

moved to classic/ via

https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/commit/c259bb21d770174f58ec9efd4a99bac32d379ddf



Comparing the directory trees:



Upstream: webdriver/tests/{classic,bidi,support}

Blink: webdriver/tests/{classic,perform_actions,support}



Bidi is not in blink because it is deactivated in

third_party/blink/web_tests/W3CImportExpectations

(https://crbug.com/974254), leaving perform_actions as the sole

leftover.

entry.title: Avoid dangling pointer in FormFetcherImpl.
entry.content:
ManagePasswordsUIController has a ManagePasswordsState member that

may own PasswordFormManagers that, in turn, may own a FormFetcher.

This FormFetcher keeps a raw pointer to the PasswordManagerClient.

However, both ManagePasswordsUIController and PasswordManagerClient

extend WebContentsUserData and therefore their destruction order is

undefined.



This CL removes ManagePasswordsUIController from the WebContents

(i.e. destroying itself) on observing the event that the WebContents

will be destroyed to avoid that the pointer to PasswordManagerClient

becomes dangling.



Bug: 1462325

Change-Id: I343f5220288c11a5310b6d089be0806b18c5a0b7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4678755

entry.title: dlp: Pass block/warn file name in ProgressStatus
entry.content:
Stores the name of the first blocked or warning file and passes it to

the Files app when the task completes with error / is paused. This is

needed in order to properly show the panel items (notifications) when a

single file is restricted by the policy - the notification text should

use that file's name to make it clear for the user which files to check.

This is only relevant for the single restricted file case, as with more

than one, the notification has a Review button which opens a dialog with

all the affected files listed. Therefore it's fine to always pass the

first warn/block file - which is the correct one for single file case,

and is ignored for multi file case, and is less complicated then

ensuring that this value is passed IFF a single file is restricted.



R=chromeos-dlp@google.com, lucmult@chromium.org



Fixed: b:290769150

Change-Id: Ia7534307d319806754dff927750121a4d51b08b1

entry.title: Reland "[BestEffortServiceWorker] Improve redirect compatibility"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit e680c77a639d1ff4b29e033be0cc47e5194acf6c

Added build flags for Fuchsia to disable added tests. We don't have a

plan to enable this feature on Fuchsia, so it should be OK.



Original change's description:

> [BestEffortServiceWorker] Improve redirect compatibility

>

> This is a follow-up of crrev.com/c/4668647

>

> This CL makes BestEffortServiceWorker redirect handling consistent with

> the current default behavior by not handling redirect responses.

>

> When redirects happen, currently RaceNetworkRequest handles them by

> itself, for the main and subresources respectively. For main resources,

> the loader marks the state as completed and defer the second request to

> its owner, which is NavigationURLLoaderImpl. For subresources, the

> loader follows redirects and dispatch a second request, then handle it.

>

> The current behavior is problematic because as a default, ServiceWorker

> handles redirections "inside" its fetch event, which can involve opaque

> responses or opaque redirect responses, and returns them to the

> browser/renderer process. But if BestEffortServiceWorker is enabled,

> redirections are handled in RaceNetworkRequest, and responses are not

> forwarded to the SW fetch handler, that could be a compatibility issue

> especially for the Cache storage consistency.

>

> This CL fixes this problem by not handling the redirect response in the

> RaceNetworkRequest. More correctly, RaceNetworkRequest as a

> URLLoaderClient receives a redirect signal, then immediately forward it

> to the other URLLoaderClient, which is fused to the endpoint in blink

> side in order for the dedupe. And RaceNetworkRequest starts waiting from

> the second response and doesn't do a race anymore.

>

> URLLoader endpoints are well distributed and fused for the dedupe

> between RaceNetworkRequest and the fetch request in SW, here is a rough

> diagram of URLLoader relations.

> https://docs.google.com/document/d/1eotFetBW9RUE2sYjCnVl7P8rbvIsWBJcy3NOswC5kek/edit#bookmark=id.sx0vwv3n7gut

>

> This CL also removes the code canceling in-flight RaceNetworkRequests in

> the main and subresource loader classes. It used to be a reasonable

> approach, but after we introduced a dedupe mechanism, it increased test

> flakiness because sometimes data transport is not completed yet at the

> time when the loader received a response from fetch handler. Even if the

> ServiceWorker respond, the data pipe may be still active due to the

> redirect, StaleWhileRevalidate etc.

>

> Change-Id: Ifd72daec858c0e770e8938705dcbe01d17bfa0b1

> Bug: 1420517

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4668283

> Reviewed-by: Kouhei Ueno

> Commit-Queue: Shunya Shishido

> Reviewed-by: Yoshisato Yanagisawa

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1169715}



Bug: 1420517, 1431421

entry.title: Deflake http/tests/images/document-policy-oversized-images-resize.php
entry.content:
What I tried:

1. Do not use `autoNotifyDone` from `runAfterLayoutAndPaint`. I suspect

we might call `waitUntilDone()` after the test runner ends, because

of the `setTimeout` and `requestAnimationFrame` in the middle.



2. Similarly to the other `document-policy-oversized-images-*`, make use

of: `updateAllLifecyclePhasesAndCompositeThen`. I suspect this is

needed to ensure the test do not end before being able to render the

new images to their new size.

entry.title: Store a scoped_refptr instead of raw_ptr
entry.content:
CookieSettingsFactory::GetForProfile returns a scoped_refptr. If

`.get()` is called on that scoped_refptr immediately, then

~scoped_refptr is called as the pointer goes out of scope, which may

result in the pointee being freed. Therefore, it is better to store

the scoped_refptr directly, so that the pointee won't get accidentally

freed while we hold a pointer to it.



Change-Id: I278cdb3b805e7d1f57d63d3656f208c33a5a7dee

entry.title: Modernize BackendImpl::MaxBuffersSize
entry.content:
disk_cache::BackendImpl::MaxBuffersSize() calculates the result only on

the first run, then reuses the result stored in a static variable.

However, it uses two static variables when it only needs one.



Simplify it to use a single static variable by using an

immediately-executed lambda to calculate the value.



As a side benefit the method becomes thread-safe.



Change-Id: I611ceb03294a97e9f50568b98dabbcbdd1353448

entry.title: Improve EndDragging and UpdateDragging code
entry.content:
This CL improves the two methods mentioned in the title. Of note:



- Previously, the `update_callback` was being replaced rather than chained, potentially causing only one update callback to run. (In practice, this is flaky to produce because updating is so fast)

- Some mouse events would not be rescheduled before if dragging was canceled. Now they are properly rescheduled. (Again, hard to reproduce since updating and ending happens so fast).

- Added some optimization which uses an existing "host hint" from `GetRenderWidgetHostAtPointAsynchronously`. This branch occurs the most often.



This CL also fixes an issue where DragTargetDrop would trigger a second DragOver because the `host` may not be up to date. We now always call `GetRenderWidgetHostAtPointAsynchronously` after an update (if no host hint is provided). See https://github.com/GoogleChromeLabs/chromium-bidi/actions/runs/5523505156/jobs/10074531531?pr=1012 for an example failure. This issue is flaky for similar reasons stated above.



Bug: 1430420

Fixed: 1459188

Change-Id: If4fc285aa4098c0b62d5761b08edf797a0184853

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4679162

entry.title: [Privacy Hub] Fix blinking effect in camera hw switch notification
entry.content:
This CL stops showing/removing camera hardware switch notification on

app capability access update. The notification will be displayed by

listening to changes in active clients, OnActiveClientChange.



App capability access data does not identify which camera the app is

using. So displaying camera specific notification depending on the app

capability access update may result in unwanted notifications.



Using different observers to display same notification is also causing

blinking effect.



Bug: b:290877430



Change-Id: I999908f7c9efeb988e5b8f90ca9130c33e3b06f0

entry.content:
The cost of making the ANGLE context current is surprisingly high. This

CL adds metrics that record this cost (a) for only the initial call, and

(b) for only non-initial calls. The aim is to determine whether there's

something happening on the initial call that is causing it to be

particularly costly.

entry.title: Revert "[BestEffortServiceWorker] Improve redirect compatibility"
entry.content:
This reverts commit e680c77a639d1ff4b29e033be0cc47e5194acf6c.



Reason for revert: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/fuchsia-arm64-rel/7878/overview ServiceWorkerRaceNetworkRequestBrowserTest.Subresource_FetchHandler_Wins_Redirect failing





Original change's description:

> [BestEffortServiceWorker] Improve redirect compatibility

>

> This is a follow-up of crrev.com/c/4668647

>

> This CL makes BestEffortServiceWorker redirect handling consistent with

> the current default behavior by not handling redirect responses.

>

> When redirects happen, currently RaceNetworkRequest handles them by

> itself, for the main and subresources respectively. For main resources,

> the loader marks the state as completed and defer the second request to

> its owner, which is NavigationURLLoaderImpl. For subresources, the

> loader follows redirects and dispatch a second request, then handle it.

>

> The current behavior is problematic because as a default, ServiceWorker

> handles redirections "inside" its fetch event, which can involve opaque

> responses or opaque redirect responses, and returns them to the

> browser/renderer process. But if BestEffortServiceWorker is enabled,

> redirections are handled in RaceNetworkRequest, and responses are not

> forwarded to the SW fetch handler, that could be a compatibility issue

> especially for the Cache storage consistency.

>

> This CL fixes this problem by not handling the redirect response in the

> RaceNetworkRequest. More correctly, RaceNetworkRequest as a

> URLLoaderClient receives a redirect signal, then immediately forward it

> to the other URLLoaderClient, which is fused to the endpoint in blink

> side in order for the dedupe. And RaceNetworkRequest starts waiting from

> the second response and doesn't do a race anymore.

>

> URLLoader endpoints are well distributed and fused for the dedupe

> between RaceNetworkRequest and the fetch request in SW, here is a rough

> diagram of URLLoader relations.

> https://docs.google.com/document/d/1eotFetBW9RUE2sYjCnVl7P8rbvIsWBJcy3NOswC5kek/edit#bookmark=id.sx0vwv3n7gut

>

> This CL also removes the code canceling in-flight RaceNetworkRequests in

> the main and subresource loader classes. It used to be a reasonable

> approach, but after we introduced a dedupe mechanism, it increased test

> flakiness because sometimes data transport is not completed yet at the

> time when the loader received a response from fetch handler. Even if the

> ServiceWorker respond, the data pipe may be still active due to the

> redirect, StaleWhileRevalidate etc.

>

> Change-Id: Ifd72daec858c0e770e8938705dcbe01d17bfa0b1

> Bug: 1420517

entry.title: Revert "Reland [omnibox] Instantiate presenter with webui omnibox popup view..."
entry.content:
This reverts commit b4914c745b02fb787d11275845b70c0571f84a75.



Reason for revert: Breaking https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Tests%20(Wayland)/39912/overview MenuItemViewTestInsert02.InsertItem02



Original change's description:

> Reland [omnibox] Instantiate presenter with webui omnibox popup view...

>

> This CL does 3 things: expands lifetime, holds open for devtools, and

> significantly upgrades testability of the webui omnibox popup view.

>

> First, it expands the lifetime of OmniboxPopupPresenter to that of the

> owning OmniboxPopupViewWebUI instead of instantiating on demand during

> updates. This fixes an issue where initial input and suggestions were

> not shown by the popup.

>

> Additionally, this CL considers the devtools status before closing the

> popup so the native view can be inspected. See for more context:

> https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4643132/comments/ac88c013_90e2aa58

>

> Finally, this CL makes it possible to cleanly test the webui omnibox

> popup view by first waiting for the webui handler to become available

> and bound by the remote. Before this blocking mechanism was

> implemented, there were various failure modes relating to the webui

> handler, particularly absence before navigation, and then even when

> it was present, calls could be made before the remote was bound, which

> would also cause crashes. Now it reliably navigates, binds, and works!

>

> Bug: 1458266, 1396174

> Change-Id: I96ad9213aaee6b4c598204f40dd8c697ec5da4d1

Chromium, causing it to treat is as an YCbCr format when such a GBM

buffer is imported or created. Fix this by checking the VkFormat

directly instead of the buffer's plane count.

entry.title: [Policy] Status Box enhancements
entry.content:
The Status Box is created using fieldset, this CL transitions them to use Div instead.

Fieldsets are rarely used and don't look good.

They provide very few customisations and were primarily made to group form fields.



The CL also beautifies them by adding background colour (same as search), rounded corners, consistent sizing, responsiveness and better - margins, padding, and font.

entry.title: Mitigation for crash issue on MacOS due to thumbnail capture
entry.content:
We see increased crashes on MacOS when we added settings for hovercard.

The issue was seen for users even without the feature enabled. After

investigation we tracked it down to change when we introduced prefs for

hovercards we had to unconditionally enable the thumbnail helper. This

resulted in thumbnail capture to happen whenever the tabs were put into

the background irrespective of the pref state. As an initial mitigation

creating the tab helper only when the new settings flag is enabled. This

change is to unblock Canary and Dev channels. Subsequently we either

need to do further investigation on the crash issue which based on

previous investigation likely is due to graphic drivers or make this

capture conditional (though currently thumbnail logic is agnostic of

this).



Bug: 1374153

Change-Id: I09a820a3b3f5ab2c6b0195d0346ba287a21b4631

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4682617

Reviewed-by: Dana Fried

Commit-Queue: Eshwar Stalin

Code-Coverage: Findit

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1169739}
